radiographic_examinations.findings: normal lung fields and mild cardiomegaly

severe dilatation of the right ventricle at end diastole (56 mm) and of the right atrium at end systole (74 mm, area of 43 cm2), paradoxical ventricular septal motion, severe tricuspid regurgitation (vena contracta = 11 mm), normal left ventricular ejection fraction (65%), main pulmonary artery diameter of 32 mm
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: At the 3-month follow-up, showed normal functioning prosthesis, absence of peri-prosthetic regurgitation, and partial recovery of RV function with TAPSE of 12 mm and fractional area change of 35%

radiographic_examinations.findings: total absence of the posterior tricuspid leaflet, large regurgitant orifice, slightly hypoplastic anterior leaflet, and normal septal leaflet
confirmed the absence of the posterior tricuspid leaflet
normal pulmonary arterial pressure of 26/6 mmHg and a Qp/Qs ratio of 1
normally functioning prosthesis with normal transvalvular gradients (maximum/medium = 7/4 mmHg) and mild (Grade I) TR, moderately impaired RV function (TAPSE = 7-8 mm)
